entities.name: fudge
entities.description: Fudge is the Minister of Magic who has a conversation with the Prime Minister about keeping the wizarding world hidden from non-magical people. He mentions that he only bothers the Prime Minister if there's something serious going on that affects Muggles.

entities.name: prime minister
entities.description: The Prime Minister is a non-magical person who has a conversation with Fudge about keeping the wizarding world hidden. He's initially dumbstruck and then finds his voice to ask if Fudge is a hoax.

entities.name: muggles
entities.description: Muggles are non-magical people who live in the world alongside wizards. Fudge mentions that he only bothers the Prime Minister if something serious is going to affect Muggles.

entities.name: opposition
entities.description: The opposition is a group of people who are against Fudge and his policies. They're mentioned as planning a hoax to discredit Fudge.

relationships.description: Fudge has a conversation with the Prime Minister about keeping the wizarding world hidden from non-magical people.
Fudge is concerned about the impact of the wizarding world on Muggles and only bothers the Prime Minister if something serious is going to affect them.
The Prime Minister initially distrusts Fudge, thinking he might be a hoax planned by the opposition.
